title: Anjaneri Fort
subtitle: The Mythical Birthplace of Lord Hanuman near Nashik
overview: Anjaneri Fort, located near Nashik in Maharashtra, holds immense mythological and historical importance. Believed to be the birthplace of Lord Hanuman, this fort lies amid the lush Anjaneri Hills, part of the Sahyadri range.

The fort is not just a trekking destination but also a sacred site, attracting pilgrims and adventurers alike. The path to the top is scenic and offers panoramic views of the surrounding valleys, waterfalls, and the Trimbakeshwar range.

highlights.title: Mythological Significance
highlights.description: Regarded as the birthplace of Lord Hanuman, Anjaneri Fort is an important pilgrimage site for devotees and spiritual seekers.

highlights.title: Scenic Trek
highlights.description: A moderate trek through rolling hills and waterfalls leading to temples and ancient fort ruins atop the Anjaneri Hills.

geography.intro: Anjaneri Fort is located about 20 km from Nashik and 6 km from Trimbakeshwar, situated at an altitude of around 1,300 meters above sea level.

climate.description: The region experiences pleasant weather most of the year, with monsoon offering lush greenery and cool winds.

seasons.text: Best time: October to February for clear views
Monsoon (June–September) enhances greenery but trails get slippery

geography.conclusion: The combination of spirituality, scenic beauty, and adventure makes Anjaneri Fort a unique destination in Maharashtra.

activities.title: Trekking
activities.description: A serene trek with gradual climbs through forested trails, ancient steps, and viewpoints.
info: Duration: 1.5–2 hours to reach the top

activities.title: Temple Visits
activities.description: Visit the Anjani Mata Temple, dedicated to Lord Hanuman’s mother, located atop the hill.

activities.title: Photography
activities.description: Capture panoramic views of the Sahyadri ranges, waterfalls, and temples.
info: Morning treks offer best light conditions

attractions.title: Anjani Mata Temple
attractions.description: A small yet significant temple marking the mythical birthplace of Lord Hanuman.

attractions.title: Trimbakeshwar Temple
attractions.description: One of the 12 Jyotirlingas of Lord Shiva, located close to Anjaneri.

marineLife.intro: Although inland, Anjaneri’s natural life is vibrant with diverse flora and fauna.

items.title: Flora
items.description: Dense forests with wildflowers and medicinal herbs

items.title: Fauna
items.description: Monkeys, peacocks, and a variety of birds common in the region

conclusion: Ideal for nature lovers and bird watchers.
A tranquil environment offering peace and spiritual calmness.

howToReach.title: By Road
details: Located 20 km from Nashik and 6 km from Trimbakeshwar.
Easily accessible via Nashik–Trimbakeshwar road; parking available at base village.

howToReach.title: By Train
details: Nearest railway station: Nashik Road (25 km).
Auto rickshaws and cabs available from Nashik to Anjaneri base.

gallery.alt: Anjani Mata Temple atop the hill

bookingTips.description: Start early morning to avoid afternoon heat during the climb.
Wear trekking shoes and carry enough water, especially in summer.
Avoid heavy rains; trails can get slippery in monsoon.
